alert.note: Alert for Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 4:14AM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause considerable blowing snow at times. * WHERE...Menominee County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the commutes this evening and Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snowfall accumulations of 1 to 3 inches could be seen ahead of the Winter Storm Warning today, with the highest snow totals expected near the city of Menominee.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
